title: Social Learning Strategies to Improve Learning Outcomes in Entrepreneurship Training Programs

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced theoretical knowledge and mastery of high-level application skills
context.additional_context: A course exploring social learning strategies to maximize the effectiveness of entrepreneurship training programs for pre-service and in-service teachers. Focuses on building confidence through peer collaboration and support, and developing applicable real-world educational cases.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the importance of peer support and social learning in an entrepreneurship training program.
Learners can analyze social risks that may arise during the entrepreneurship process and develop response strategies.
Learners can design one entrepreneurship education module through project-based assessment in a mobile microlearning environment.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
